trans-unit.source: Designing a WCF Contract for Service Bus
trans-unit.target: Designing a WCF Contract for Service Bus

trans-unit.source: The following topics describe how to design a <token>indigo1</token> service contract that can be registered to be available on a <token>sb2</token> endpoint.
trans-unit.target: The following topics describe how to design a <token>indigo1</token> service contract that can be registered to be available on a <token>sb2</token> endpoint.

trans-unit.source: This topic describes how to create a SOAP-based <token>indigo2</token> service contract that can be configured to use <token>sb2</token>.
trans-unit.target: This topic describes how to create a SOAP-based <token>indigo2</token> service contract that can be configured to use <token>sb2</token>.

trans-unit.source: This topic describes how to create a REST-based <token>indigo2</token> service contract that can be configured to use <token>sb2</token>.
trans-unit.target: This topic describes how to create a REST-based <token>indigo2</token> service contract that can be configured to use <token>sb2</token>.

trans-unit.source: Because <token>indigo2</token> service contracts – whether SOAP- or REST-based – can be hosted in <token>azure_2</token>, you can follow the instructions in either of the previous two topics.
trans-unit.target: Because <token>indigo2</token> service contracts – whether SOAP- or REST-based – can be hosted in <token>azure_2</token>, you can follow the instructions in either of the previous two topics.
